title: ABC, SBS cuts: one in 10 to lose jobs, regional offices closed â as it happened | Media | The Guardian
summary: more job losses to come , says scott .
radio national shows and jobs to go .
women 's football , basketball first confirmed cuts in sport coverage .
100 news staff to go , key programs hit .
abc board endorses budget cut measures .

text: that 's where we 'll leave our live coverage .
below is a short summary of the key aspects of the $ 254m in budget cuts to the abc and $ 53m to sbs .

400 people , or 10 % of staff will be let go , mark scott anticipates 10 % of job cuts to be management positions , dismantling state and territory director structure 25 % of job cuts will be in the news division , 70 new jobs in digital , resulting in 30 losses more job losses to come , scott confirms adelaide tv production studio to close tv production in smaller states to wind down , basing it in sydney and melbourne regional radio posts in wagin , morwell , gladstone , port augusta and nowra to close a scaling back of sports involvement and rationalisation of outside broadcast wnbl and w-league axed bush telegraph axed stateline axed , replaced by end-of-week 7.30 edition lateline to shift to abc24 savings to be found in landline , abc fact check , four corners , foreign correspondent and australian story .
foreign news resources will be concentrated in washington dc ( one job lost there ) , london , beijing and jakarta , plus a new bureau will open in beirut .

abc classic fm to cut back concerts lanceley place in sydney to be sold numerous radio national shows and features axed or reshuffled most radio news bulletins reduced to five minutes in length sbs dateline reduced to half an hour other budget savings at sbs will be countered by proposed changes in advertising on the network
these cuts belong to the federal government , community and public sector union ( cpsu ) president michael tull has said in a statement .
after promising not to cut , the government has cut millions from the abc 's budget and forced it to slash one in 10 jobs from its workforce .
it is now abundantly clear that the government 's cuts will seriously impact the quality of programming , despite assurances by malcolm turnbull to the contrary .
programs are being cut and regional radio offices are closing so once again the government is lying when it said that the cuts to the abc budget would not affect the public .
tull said the cpsu would begin formal consultation with the abc on wednesday , and will be looking for more detail and justification for these cuts .
we are absolutely opposed to compulsory redundancies and we will fight them tooth and nail .
we want to protect as many jobs as possible , he said .
some more comment on today 's announcement .
they came to gut the national broadcaster , but instead they tore out the regional heart of australia , writes michael idato for fairfax .

it was embarrassing enough watching the communications minister malcolm turnbull try to cast an election eve lie that there would be no cuts to either of our national broadcasters as something less like a promise and more like chatter among the real housewives of canberra .

now , how can the government explain these cuts to voters in australia 's vast regional heart , whose voice , and whose right to see their own world reflected on the television screen , and on the airwaves , has been brutally smashed to pieces with what amounts to a political hammer ?
read more here .
if you do n't watch the news you do n't know what 's going on , van badham 's dad would tell her as a kid .

in the wake of the extraordinary cuts to the abc and sbs this week , i can only imagine that the architects of this savage attack on our national broadcasters the coalition government , its supporters in the murdoch press and the conservative free market think tanks were told by their own ideological papas the exact same thing .
read badham 's column in full , here .
the lovely first dog on the moon has lent his pen to abc and sbs today .
cast your eye over the full comic here .
thanks to all the good folk currently or up till now working for the abc first dog on the moon , on abc budget cuts australia
crikey has a very good roundup of the specific cuts and consequences to abc and sbs that we know of so far .
you can read it here .
richard glover is pushing scott on a number of the criticisms of the cuts .
first is the drastic closures of regional radio offices , and the impacts on regional abc .
scott says far more jobs are going from sydney than anywhere else in the country , but when you look for efficiencies , economies of scale are what matter .
it 's cheaper to centralise production in a place like sydney .
on to the next question .
q : how does a five minute reduction in the length of news bulletins save money ?
a : rostering , basically , is the answer .
we felt in the morning audiences were hungry for the lengthier bulletin .
not so much in the afternoon .
q : how does moving lateline to abc24 save anything ?
it opens up a lot of our thinking , scott answers .
as well as something about reinvesting .
to be honest he did n't really answer how this particular move saves any money .
his parting comments are in defence of the concentration on digital delivery of abc news and content .
if they did n't make sure they were on top of it , in a few years time we would be viewed as the people who were negligent when the revolution was inevitable , he says .
the abc is too important to fritter away its future .

documents.title: more job losses to come , says scott
text: scott tells abc radio he tries to argue to case for the abc when he speaks with politicians , and has told them if there were big cuts on this year and next year that would have a big impact on content .
despite malcolm turnbull saying the cut would be 5 % off the top over five years , scott says in the outer years it 's more like 8 % , and the abc had to find $ 63m by the 5th year .
we 've got to start now it 's a very sad day at the public broadcaster .
he also says there will be more job cuts to come to find those savings , as well as increase investment in digital as competitors spend more money on it .
mark scott is speaking to abc 702 in sydney at the moment .
he 's dismissed suggestions that the abc is too big and harming other media companies because it offers online content for free .
we think we have great content that our public has paid for .
and having paid for it they are entitled to receive it when , how , and where they want it , for free , he said .
he said it was a weak argument that abc should face same cuts as fairfax , news and aap have .
these revenue cuts have been very very tough on the quality of these media outlets , he said .
just because the quality has suffered that 's not a reason to do the same to the abc .
question time : christopher pyne accuses shorten of confected outrage because shorten has n't said anything about what he would put back in to the abc and sbs .
much of question time today has been bill shorten hassling the prime minister about his no cuts promise on the even of the election .
the opposition wants to suspend standing orders to debate the abc and sbs cuts .
it 's worth following it all over at guardian australia 's politics live blog with gabi chan , as i 'll stay with other reactions and fallout .
here is a recent snippet from gabi .
after ducking and weaving on the actual broken promise , tony abbott then says instead of just getting $ 6.9bn over the next five years , the abc and the sbs are getting $ 6.6 billion .
no biggie .

documents.title: radio national shows and jobs to go
text: there will be six redundancies from abc rural with the axing of bush telegraph .
these do not come out of the proposed radio national redundancies .
background briefing 's canberra based reporter to move to melbourne , and in an odd move , the sydney team will cover canberra stories .
one possible redundancy .
features to be significantly changed .
decommissioning of 360documentaries , hindsight , encounter , into the music and poetica .
more features from independent and freelance producers will be commissioned , at standard 28-minute length , broadcast on new features program four days a week .
new features and documentaries unit comprising 13 staff , with producers to be selected from decommissioned shows .
there will be one possible redundancy with rn drive to be cut by 30 minutes , and to pool resources with sunday extra .
one possible redundancy with the merging of books and arts daily and the weekend arts teams .
by design and rn first bite to be axed , replaced with a two-hour program out of melbourne .
one possible redundancy .
weekend planet , the quiet space and sound quality shows to go , making room for jazztrack moving to rn from abc classic fm .
daily planet will increase to five days .
a junior network reporter position in perth has been proposed , contributing to rn programs .
two editorial co-ordinators for features and the creative audio unit to focus on commissioning content from freelance and independent producers .
bill shorten opens question time with a hit at the prime minister over the cuts , and references the promise made on the eve of the election that there would be no cuts to the abc or sbs .
abbott rejects the premise of the question .

what we said before the election was that we 'd stop the carbon tax , stop the boats , build the roads of the 21st century and get the budget back under control and that is exactly what we 're doing , said abbott .
this government has fundamentally kept faith .
cue jeers from the opposition side of the room .
it 's a big day for euphemisms .
i 'm not seeing the words cut , close or redundancy in the official memos and speeches nearly as much as realigning , reinvigorating , revamping , and restructuring are popping up .
joe o'brien ( @ joeobrien24 ) abc news boss kate torney addressing news staff in ultimo newsroom now biggest i 've seen .

documents.title: women 's football , basketball first confirmed cuts in sport coverage
text: abc broadcasting of the women 's football league and wnbl will not come back .
peter wilkins ( @ wilkosport ) @ naomiwoodley sad .
recently @ twitterid perth v mel match attracted 100k viewers nationally .
believed largest non-finals audience .
growing .
the government has set about to destroy the national broadcaster , despite having no mandate to do so , abc friends spokeswoman , gleys stradijot has said .
we now know the government 's cuts will have a devastating impact on the national broadcaster 's capacity to do its job .
the abc will be unable to fulfil its charter obligations or meet its responsibility to be a truly national public broadcaster which services australians across the country .
malcolm turnbull has been a huge disappointment .
he has revealed himself to be no friend of the abc .

minister turnbull 's earlier assurances that his so-called efficiency measures would not affect services and programming have turned out to be as dishonest as the prime minister 's pre-election promise not to cut the abc .

documents.title: no redundancy program at sbs
text: budget savings at sbs will be countered by proposed changes in advertising on the network , according to sbs journalist , stephanie anderson .
stephanie anderson ( @ stephanieando ) no redundancy program as part of # sbscuts .
$ 28 million cut to revenue expected to be countered by proposed changes to advertising .
communications spokesman for the greens , senator scott ludlam , has released a statement on the abc cuts .
the government is attempting to weaken the abc and sbs from the inside , through the first tranche in what will no doubt become an ongoing series of annual cuts to the broadcasters , said ludlam .
the cuts also reveal the deep moral bankruptcy of this government .
turnbull 's farcical attempt last week to explain away abbott 's no cuts to the abc or sbs election commitment reveals a deep contempt for the intelligence of the australian public .

the australian greens will fight to see this funding restored to the abc and sbs and to ensure that these two highly trusted and respected institutions continue to receive the funding that they need , said senator ludlam .

any organisation can be more efficient , but the government needs to find efficiencies in abc and sbs and pass them on to services for australian people , opposition communications spokesman , jason clare , has told media a few minutes ago .
this pm is not doing that , he 's just lying to the australian people .
we 're talking about half a billion dollars here when you add in the cuts to the australia network , said clare .
he said pyne 's petition was unbelievable , and called him pontius pilate .
federal government minister christopher pyne is disgusted with the closure of the adelaide production studio .
it is clear that the abc is using a modest efficiency dividend as an excuse to continue a long held strategy to centralise their television model in the eastern states , he said in a statement .
last week pyne launched an online petition protesting against the rumoured closure , prompted by the budget cuts made by his government .

documents.title: foreign bureaux
text: the auckland bureau will close , it 's been confirmed .

foreign news resources will be concentrated in washington dc ( one job lost there ) , london , beijing and jakarta , plus - perhaps , depending on how well resourced it is - the aforementioned new bureau in beirut .
other places will operate with one video journalist plus a fixer , and a number of local producers will lose their jobs , according to am world today 's lexi metherell .

documents.title: 100 news staff to go , key programs hit
text: director of abc news , kate torney , is addressing her staff now .
she 's said there will be 100 redundancies in the news division .
update : torney has said australian story , landline , fact check and four corners will bear the brunt of cuts .
most radio news bulletins will also be halved in length .
naomi woodley ( @ naomiwoodley ) abc news director kate torney confirms all but the 7am and 7:45am radio news bulletins will be cut to 5 minutes .
prime minister tony abbott , has this morning attended the launch of the kmart wishing tree .
the timing of the photo was not exactly fortunate , occurring just minutes after the details were announced about the federal government 's budget cuts to abc and sbs .
despite the opposition leader bill shorten and greens leader christine milne also being the photograph has provided an opportunity for distraction/amusement in some people .
the original is first .

tony abbott ( @ tonyabbottmhr ) launching the # kmartwishingtree - we want all australian families to have the best possible christmas @ twitterid tree abc news intern ( @ abcnewsintern ) everybody gets a budget cut !
you get a b mt @ twitterid : we want all families to have the best possible christmas andy park ( @ andy park ) meanwhile guess what 's in the presents ?
# abccuts jessie borrelle ( @ rainbowandarrow ) against advice @ twitterid ltd personally delivers redundancy packages to devastated journalists & staff # abccuts
helen tzarimas interviewed newcastle radio afternoon presenter , carol duncan , about her meeting this morning .

chris warren , federal secretary of the media entertainment and arts alliance ( meaa ) said australia was seeing one of , if not the largest shake-out of jobs here at the abc , where really it was totally unnecessary .
of course once the money was withdrawn from the abc , then job losses were inevitable and loss of content and programming was the inevitable result of that , he told abc news 24 .

i think the abc or public broadcasting is a really critical and important role that governments play , or that governments fund , particularly in the current environment where commercial media is under such enormous pressure .
the minuscule savings they 've got in terms of the scale of the budget they 're dealing with is really not worth the loss to australian culture , democracy and society that flows from there .
quentin dempster , nsw edition host of the now-axed stateline , has told radio national the cuts confirm the abc is sydney-centric .
investment in digital technology and platforms has been presented as the silver lining to the budget cuts , but it 's missed the point .
we 're meant to be getting more localism out of the digital revolution , not less , he told rn .
amanda has written up a full report on today 's cuts at the abc .
read her article here .
independent mp for indi , cathy mcgowan has called the axing of bush telegraph a big mistake .
cathy mcgowan ( @ indigocathy ) big mistake to cut @ twitterid , rural stories vital for cty/city audience , abc board & gov need to support 'bush tele ' # abccuts # inditalks
this just in from guardian australia 's media correspondent , amanda meade : a spokesman for communications minister malcolm turnbull has questioned scott 's comment that one in 10 staff would go .
according to the annual report there are 5 444 people employed at the abc in total , although some are in part time roles .
in 201314 , the abc employed 5 444 people across every state and territory , equivalent to 4 679 full time employees .
the majority of staff were content makers .
( read the report here , reference page 79 )
greens leader christine milne said the decision to close five regional radio offices was in conflict with the charter to provide for all australians .
labor mp for adelaide , kate ellis said the decision to close the city 's tv production studio was devastating but it must not mark the end of our fight for fair abc funding and secure sa jobs .

coalition minister christopher pyne , who broke ranks somewhat this week by starting a petition to keep the south australian production office open , tweeted his letters to mark scott and james spigelman .
it is not possible that production and administration in ultimo could be less expensive than in adelaide , he wrote before the announcement that it would in fact close .
christopher pyne ( @ cpyne ) my letters this morning to @ twitterid and james spigelman of the abc : the abc must not stop production in sa .
# auspol kate ellis ( @ kateellismp ) sa abc studios are in adelaide electorate -this news is devastating but must not mark end of our fight for fair abc funding & secure sa jobs
of the 400 job losses , 300 are to take place immediately , according to lateline reporter jason om .
jason om ( @ jason om ) breaking mark scott : 300 redundancies immediately ; total 400 # abccuts # auspol # ourabc

documents.title: abc board endorses budget cut measures
text: in a statement released a few minutes ago , the abc board has endorsed the cuts and restructures announced by mark scott .
the initiatives outlined by mr scott comprise a carefully considered response to the twin challenges of technological change and reduced funding .

they provide funds to invest in essential new online and mobile strategies that better connect the abc with its audiences the initiatives maintain the abc 's fundamental commitment to the provision of programming that contributes to a sense of national identity ; that informs , educates and entertains and which reflects the cultural diversity of the australian community .

in its contribution to the process , the board has had particular regard to its responsibility to ensure the functions of the corporation are performed efficiently and with the maximum benefit to the people of australia .
the board 's letter concluded with an expression of regret that so many competent and loyal employees will lose their jobs and a veiled swipe at the federal government .
unfortunately this is the inevitable consequence of the necessity to adjust to reduced funding and to ensure that the abc is not marginalised in the new media landscape .
on the other side of the sydney harbour bridge , michael ebeid has been much more upbeat about the state of sbs 's budget .
he 's told staff that sbs will not be slashing and burning our content budgets and confirmed that dateline will definitely be returning in 2015 .
it 's a tough day for the abc , he told staff in artarmon .
there is no redundancy program as such for sbs said ebeid .

we regard the changes as vital to securing the long-term health of the organisation but i acknowledge that is no comfort to those who will lose their positions , mark scott said about the job losses .
scott will visit abc branches in each state and territory over the next two weeks .

the message i will convey , both internally and externally , over the next few weeks is that the abc can not stand still and run the risk of becoming less relevant and compelling to this and future generations , he said .
what we are doing today is in the best interests of the abc and its many stakeholders .
it is designed to position the organisation for the future .
working together , we can be confident in our ability to see through these changes and to build astronger abc .
while everyone at the ultimo offices heard the news in person from scott , regional and other city bureaux tuned in remotely .

documents.title: new abc divisions , transfers
text: abc innovation will be replaced with a new digital division , abc digital network , to prioritise online and mobile .
the abc is also planning a new regional division , with a director located outside sydney and melbourne .
the division will bring together regional radio and news staff and look afresh at how we best deploy our knowledge , skills and technology .
the creation of this regional division will impact on work flows for local radio and digital services .
more details to come from abc radio .
abc news is to take responsibility of news radio .
it 's currently under control of abc radio .
a reshaped division to consist of : local radio stations in capital cities radio national classic fm triple j

the rather vague rationalisation of outside sport broadcasting has been given a little more clarity in a media release from the abc , which says the abc will conduct an overhaul of sports coverage , with a focus on national sporting events .
televised local competitions are not looking good for the future .

documents.title: one in 10 to lose job , regional stations to close
text: mark scott has released the cuts and justifications for said cuts .

here is where the hits are landing : 400 people , or 10 % of staff will be let go , scott anticipates 10 % of job cuts to be management positions , dismantling state and territory director structure adelaide tv production studio to close tv production in smaller states to wind down , basing it in sydney and melbourne regional radio posts in wagin , morwell , gladstone , port augusta and nowra to close a scaling back of sports involvement and rationalisation of outside broadcast lanceley place in sydney to be sold stateline to go , replaced by end-of-week 7.30 edition lateline to shift to abc24 foreign bureaux reshaped , new beirut bureau abc classic fm to cut back concerts read mark scott 's statement in full here
sbs wo n't be taking up an offer by abc to merge their melbourne offices , ebeid has said .

documents.title: ebeid : `` it could have been a lot worse '' for sbs
text: michael ebeid has told sbs staff the cuts are mainly absorbed by back of house initiatives .
karen barlow ( @ kjbar ) sbs md @ twitterid on the sbs budget cuts : `` we should all be reasonable happy '' , `` it could have been a lot worse for us . ''
andy park ( @ andy park ) `` what the govt is actually asking for is for an incremental 15m over 4 years '' # sbscuts @ twitterid

documents.title: one in 10 to lose jobs
text: according to tweets .
we 'll have confirmation and more information for you in the next ten minutes .

documents.title: adelaide tv production to close
text: the tv production studio in adelaide will shut , and tv production in smaller states will wind back , according to people tweeting .
sbs managing director michael ebeid is addressing sbs staff now as well .
sbs have been told to find $ 53m in savings .

documents.title: the cuts - what we know
text: over the weekend it was confirmed that stateline , abc 's local editions of 7.30 , will not be coming back this year .

this morning we learned that radio national 's bush telegraph program has been axed , newcastle abc radio is likely to be relegated to a regional station , and the same appears to be on the radar for canberra .
abc staff are currently in a meeting learning exactly where and how the cuts will happen .
staff have been told not to record the 11am meeting , according to buzzfeed australia .
staff are assembling at ultimo for the all-in announcement .

john barron ( @ factcheckjohn ) christmas carols playing in the abc foyer as staff huddle before heading in to hear @ twitterid give details of # abccuts amanda roberts ( @ mandroberts ) abc cuts to be announced # abccuts
several staff at canberra 's local abc were also called in for early morning meetings today , suggesting they could also be relegated to a regional bureau , like newcastle .
greens deputy leader adam bandt says if tony abbott is feeling the pressure , the answer is as simple as abc - abide by commitments .
bandt and labor mp pat conroy have called on the government not to cut abc and sbs .
if you want to get in touch with tips or news , you can reach us via theweeklybeast @ theguardian.com
bill shorten addressed the melbourne rally yesterday , telling crowds : this is not a government of competition this is a government of censorship .
this is a government of savages , ripping at the heart of our national institution .
they are launching a brutal attack despite promising in the clearest , most unambiguous language , there will be no cuts to the abc .
about 3000 people also rallied in sydney on saturday .
read our report here .
rallies have already been held in alice springs , darwin , hobart , newcastle , perth , adelaide and brisbane , among other cities .
opposition leader bill shorten at a rally to stop cuts to the abc and sbs at federation square in melbourne nearmy/aapimage

the reason is n't clear perhaps to prevent protesters but guardian australia has been told extra security has been hired at the abc 's ultimo headquarters , and the public have been stopped from entering for four hours today .
newcastle will reportedly be relegated to a regional station , and carol duncan , the popular afternoon announcer at abc radio , newcastle , is preparing to be let go .
below are some tweets from duncan .
the first perhaps illustrates a point that many critics of the cuts have been making .
abc regional , rural and local radio particularly outside the capital cities is hugely popular and appreciated .
in really remote areas it is often the only media service focusing on their issues .
carol duncan ( @ carolduncan ) `` i 'm just a random listener but this is for you guys . ''
then he left .
@ 1233newcastle listeners are the best .
ð­ð­¤ï¸ carol duncan ( @ carolduncan ) all job offers seriously considered .
carol duncan ( @ carolduncan ) @ jessradio it is proposed that newcastle but cut to a 'regional ' station & that my program be decommissioned .
bush telegraph will end after christmas , the show has confirmed .
rn bush telegraph ( @ rnbushtele ) can confirm that we at @ twitterid have been cut .
thanks for your thoughts .
we will keep going until christmas # abccuts
not everyone is against the cuts .
louise evans , the former manager of radio national , says there is definitely fat to be cut .
writing in fairfax papers this morning , evans says she was shocked by the culture , waste , duplication and lax workplace practices exercised in some pockets when she began at the station .
it 's a harsh assessment that pulls no punches , but is worth a read .
here 's a snippet from evans , talking about rn staff .
they did n't have a 9-5 mentality .
they had a 10-3 mentality .
they planned their work day around their afternoon yoga class .
they wore thongs and shorts to work , occasionally had a snooze on the couch after lunch and popped out to paddy 's market to buy fresh produce for dinner before going home .
they were like free-range chickens , wandering around at will , pecking at this and that , content that laying one egg constituted a hard day 's work .
the meetings some staff have been called to this morning ( prior to the 11am announcement ) are to inform individuals who will be affected by the cuts before it is made public .

the community and public sector union has contacted its members and given advice to those who may be impacted : if you are called to such a meeting , you are under no obligation to accept without representation , whether that be by a union organiser , delegate or member , or another person of your choice .
should you wish to postpone the meeting until such representation is available , you have the right under your agreement to do so .
we understand that staff so impacted may want to hear the news sooner rather than later .

please be aware that these meetings are a formality by abc management there is no obligation on individuals to react , respond , or make decisions based on the content of such meetings until the formal consultation is complete and a process mutually agreed upon .

documents.title: bush telegraph axed
text: the bush telegraph program on radio national , which focuses on regional and rural news , is the first casualty of budget cuts revealed this morning .

zoe daniel ( @ zdaniel ) i can confirm that @ twitterid has been axed this morning.my husband @ twitterid is/was the executive producer.my best to the team # abccuts will ockenden ( @ will ock ) looks like bush telegraph on abc radio national will be cut .
staff informed this am - 4 jobs .
great show giving rural issues a voice .
good morning .
abc staff have been called in to early morning meetings today ahead of an all-staff briefing at 11am .
it 's expected a large number of staff will lose their job , and some regional radio services will be severely downsized or cut .
last week communications minister malcolm turnbull announced budget cuts to both the abs and sbs of $ 254m and $ 53m over five years , respectively .
i 'll be bringing you updates as they come through as well as pointing to some of the commentary that 's around about these cuts to the national broadcasters .
below is from guardian australia 's media correspondent , amanda meade .
read her full report here .

scott is expected to outline sweeping changes to the abc , including moving resources from television and radio into online and mobile services and stripping the public broadcaster of much of its internal production capacity .
a significant number of staff from abc 1233 newcastle received emails on friday , leading to fears programs from regional radio stations will be networked from the capital city .

program makers from radio national 's features unit and staff from encounter , bush telegraph , books and arts daily and classic fm staff were all told to meet their managers at human resources at 8am .

More job losses to come, says Scott

Radio National shows and jobs to go

2.55am GMT
02:55
Women's football, basketball first confirmed cuts in sport coverage

2.43am GMT
02:43
No redundancy program at SBS

2.08am GMT
02:08
100 News staff to go, key programs hit

1.03am GMT
01:03
ABC Board endorses budget cut measures

bulletin.text: Sweeping cuts across the ABC, including 400 jobs, and entire radio and TV programs, after Coalition budget cuts to the national broadcasters.
